p.s: In his speech Michel Barnier said the Brexit will be ana lose-lose situation for the European Union and the United Kingdom.
I agree with this statement and that are some Argumentsarguments which support my view.
Importing and exporting thing to the UK got sometimes more expensive and take longer, because they need to do more paperwork and pay sometimes taxes.
This is for the UK and the EU.
The second big problem is that if you want to work in the UK you need a visa.

The result is that there are missing truck drivers and other lower skilled workers, leading to missing petrol at patrolpetrol stations or rotten food in the fields as there are not enough people to harvest them.
As this problem is bigger for the UK it is also bad for people who want to immigrate to the UK.
Then a problem for the EU is the missing money that the UK stopstops paying.
A smaller problem is for the UK that the EU stopped paying.
In theory the UK payed more for the EU than it got back, but some places needed that money from the EU and need hope they will get this money from the UK government.
I have only heard of Argumentsarguments supporting the Brexit when it came to UK's independence to be free from regulations.
But I would take these downsides for free trade and free travel.
So after listing the Argumentsarguments I still think the Brexit was a bad idea and a lose-lose situation how Michel Barnier called it.
